author: s1na
content: Seems like there won't be much of an overhead for using the fixed sized variant versus basic blocks. Here I'm using a chunk size of 128 and encode the first non-data byte as a uint8 at the beginning of each chunk

author: pipermerriam
content: How hard to run on a larger data set?

author: s1na
content: im referring to the first chunking strategy i used (split by jumpdests and jumps, etc.)

author: s1na
content: The block processing speed is not very high in the current prototype (in JS). It'll have to be re-written in Go or sth

author: pipermerriam
content: Also, has anyone thought about whether we need to charge more for deployments to account for the cost of merklization?

author: s1na
content: I hadn't thought about it, but might be necessary. Specially to cover the cost of inserting the code trie in the db
